meta.author: Toria Johnson, Lily Hecke, Sindhu Suresh
meta.tagline: A simple text based adventure game written in Javascript
meta.welcome: Welcome to Panda Escape - A pilot written to test the text based adventure game engine written in Javascript. The aim of the game is to find the missing panda cub.

room1.description: You're at the entrance of the zoo. Nothing seems to be happening out here. You better go inside in the zoo. Take the west or east path. (Hint : navigate around to explore [ex: `go east`])
room1.contextualHelp: I hear something in the Panda Exhibit

room2.description: You enter the Panda Exhibit. You notice a bent cage and are surprised to find only two panda cubs in the exhibit. One is missing! You observe bamboo and a pager near the cage.
room2.contextualHelp: I wonder where the pandas went...

actions.inspect: This might be useful when searching for the panda. The cub loves to eat bamboo.
Who uses a pager these days?

room3.description: You enter the Desert Dome. You feel hot from the scorching air inside the exhibit. On the right you spot the head zookeeper.
room3.contextualHelp: Maybe the head zookeeper saw something.

actions.offer: Thank you! I had been looking for this. You know... I have a few passcodes written here that might be helpful if you need any supplies. Here is a list of a few of the passcodes.

actions.talkto: Oh heavens! I can't believe the cub escaped! What a terrible day. I lost my pocketbook and now this?!

room4.description: You enter the Aquarium. You observe different variety of colorful fish and other sea creatures. You notice an unattended camera near one of the tanks.

actions.inspect: It looks like the lens is broken. Probably useless now.

room5.description: You enter the Valley of the Gorillas. You observe ten gorillas inside the enclosure and a buff animal curator in the exhibit.
room5.contextualHelp: Maybe the senior zookeeper saw something...

actions.offer: Thanks dude, but this is not my pocketbook.

actions.talkto: How's it going?... Missing panda? Woah, man... Let me know if you need anything.

room6.description: You enter Bear Canyon. You spot see brown bears, black bears, and, what is that? There is a strange figure in the middle of the enclosure. If only you could see the figure better.
room6.contextualHelp: Maybe something around the zoo could help you see what's in the enclosure.

room7.description: You enter the Madagascar Expedition. Should you take a safari to look at all the animals? You spot binoculars and a map of the zoo at the front of the enclosure
room7.contextualHelp: I wonder when those binoculars might come in handy.

actions.inspect: Someone must have dropped these here.

room11.description: You enter the Butterfly & Insect Pavilion.  Your distate for creepy crawlers leads you to the exit very quickly. You see a small pocketbook on the floor and a volunteer near the butterfly conservatory.

actions.inspect: Someone must have dropped this here.
actions.offer: How thoughtful! But that is not my pocketbook.

actions.talkto: Hello, there!... My goodness! A missing panda?... I think I heard some loud noises in the Rainforest Room.

room9.description: You enter the Giraffe Encounter. You observe a wallet on a nearby bench and a supply closet.
room9.contextualHelp: I wonder who that wallet belongs to.

actions.inspect: It appears to belong to Morgan Freeman. Hmmm...
Its locked. I wonder where to find the passcode is...
A sturdy, steel ladder. Probably for feeding the giraffes.
A large rope net for hanging giraffe food.

room8.description: You enter the zoo's administrative offices. There is nothing spectacular about it. Just some outdated chairs.

room10.description: You enter the Rainforest Room. You enter the rainforest. It is difficult to see due to a thick layer of mist. You can barely see a utilities box in the corner.
room10.contextualHelp: I can't see anything with this mist.
